Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
LOCATION AND CONNECTIVITY 

The former Vehicle Refurbishment Centre (VRC) is located approximately 1.1 miles from J5 of the M27 providing excellent access East towards Portsmouth, West towards Bournemouth (via the A33) and North towards London via the M3. The site is accessed from the M27 via the A335 and Wide Lane where there are 5 different access points onto the site. The A335 is one of the main arterial routes into the Centre of Southampton, approximately 4.0 miles away. The site is located approximately 0.5 miles from both Southampton International Airport and Southampton Airport Parkway Railway Station. Southampton Airport Parkway Railway Station provides direct trains to London Waterloo every 30 minutes, with a journey time of approximately 1 hour 12 minutes

DESCRIPTION

The former VRC site – Freehold

There are a number of buildings on site varying in size. The main building (Building 1) is a detached unit of circa 31,784 sq ft which benefits from an eaves height of approx. 9.2m. Other buildings include a workshop/stores building of circa 13,625 sq ft (Building 2), smaller workshop/stores (buildings 3,4&5) and a commercial grade car wash (building 6). There is also an open-sided covered storage area (Building 7) of approx. 11,743 sq ft. Owned freehold, this area is approx. 5.5 acres in total, thus a very low site cover of 23%. The external areas are a mix of concrete and tarmac surface. 

The car park site – Leasehold

Located to the south west of the VRC site, the two sites are separated by a cemetery and allotments but are linked by an internal private road that runs along the boundary up against the west bound carriage way of the M27 motorway. The area provides a securely fenced and gated tarmacked parking area of approx. 4.4 acres with 528 marked out spaces. As well as the internal road linking to the VRC site, this area also has its own access via Mansbridge Road.

Held on a 10 year lease commencing 1st October 2013 and due to expire 30th September 2023. Passing rent is £94,000 per annum with 5 yearly rent reviews. 

Note: The rent review from 2018 remains outstanding.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Rare Opportunity to Purchase Freehold Industrial/Warehouse Premises with Development Potential (STP)

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: The Portway Industrial Estate lies on the western outskirts of Andover and adjacent to the ring-road leading to the A303 dual carriageway. The A303 provides access to the South West to the west and the M3 via the A34 to the east.  Andover is home of the British Army’s Land Forces new administrative HQ, and many well know national and international occupiers such as Abel & Cole, Le Creuset, Twinings, Stannah Lifts, Howard Tenens and Co-op.  The property is a detached unit of steel portal frame construction with brick/block elevations. The property has been extensively fitted out for R&D / Hi-tech use with quality open plan ancillary office accommodation, large meeting/board room and canteen.  Currently has a suspended ceiling throughout together with air conditioning and part carpeted/part anti-static flooring.  There is a large loading door located at the rear of the property.  Externally, there is a yard/parking area with parking for approx. 60 cars.  Currently held on a long leasehold basis with a lease for a term of 99 years from 10th April 1973.  Price reduced to £750,000 (equivalent to c.£35 psf) + VAT.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Long Leasehold Sale - High Quality Industrial Unit

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Kingsclere is a large village in Hampshire sitting on the A339 which provides excellent transport links to the major population centres of Basingstoke and Newbury, both of which lie approximately 8 miles from the subject property. The property is also served by the M4 Motorway to the North and the M3 to the South providing a link between London and the South Coast. Kingsclere Park itself is an established and popular business park located on the outskirts of the village.

Regency House comprises a two storey, detached high tech industrial and office unit of steel portal frame and brick construction. The ground floor of the property consists of a production and warehouse area whilst the first floor provides good quality office accommodation containing a mixture of partitioned and open plan suites.  Externally the property provides 27 marked parking spaces and a loading bay at each side of the property.
